alert.note: Alert for Alger; Baraga; Dickinson; Gogebic; Houghton; Iron; Keweenaw; Marquette; Ontonagon; Southern Houghton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 5:56AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...Wintry Weather and heavy precipitation into early next week... A slow moving early spring storm system will bring multiple rounds of precipitation to Upper Michigan through Monday. Over far western Upper Michigan, rain will mix with snow today and change to snow over high terrain. The snow will continue tonight and Sunday. Several inches of wet, dense snow accumulation will occur across Gogebic and Ontonagon Counties with lesser accumulations of snow extending across southern Houghton and Iron counties. Slushy snow accumulations on roads could make travel difficult tonight into Sunday morning. Later Sunday night, continuing into Monday night, a surge of widespread, heavier precipitation will arrive along with slightly colder air. As a result, moderate to heavy snow will develop across all of western into north central Upper Michigan. Significant accumulations of wet, dense snow will occur, especially over higher terrain. Slushy snow accumulations on roads will make travel difficult. In addition, the loading of wet, dense snow on trees combined with increasing north to northwest winds gusting to 30 to 35 mph could result in tree damage and power outages on Monday. Snow will diminish Monday night and then end during Tuesday. Total liquid precipitation amounts from today through Tuesday will be between 1 and 3 inches west of a Newberry to Iron Mountain line with locally higher amounts exceeding 4 inches possible in the high terrain of west into north central Upper Michigan. This will result in increased runoff and increased stream and river flows. Continue to monitor forecasts over the next few days as travel and other impacts are likely.
